intro: Weingartia tiraquensis var. australis, commonly known as the Tiraquén australis cactus, is a compact, slow-growing species native to northern Argentina. It features a short, cylindrical stem with a ribbed structure and is covered in dense, white to pale green spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for cactus enthusiasts.
